intro: Psephellus daghestanicus, commonly known as the Caucasian rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, adapted to harsh, arid conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
